intro: Trymalium polycephalum, commonly known as the clustered star-flower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine, white pubescence. Trymalium polycephalum thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks.
